reviews.text: We stayed at La Tonnarella for three nights in mid-September and would have stayed longer if rooms were available for this hotel. Never being to Sorrento we were concerned about the hotel's location as some reviews made us think the hotel was located walking distance of 20 to 25 minutes from Sorrento town and on a very dangerous road. We were pleased to find out that the hotel is located at most 10 minutes from shopping and stores and 25 minutes from a very busy Plazza Tasso. Yes the road is narrow but the sidewalk only requires you to walk single file in one area approx 50-60 feet long. I should add that we were travelling with our 15 month old daughter and she was in a stroller, but found the navigation of the sidewalk a very slight inconvience.
reviews.title: A Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we had booked quite late the hotel had only a room with a Sea-view available. We found the room to be another pleasent surprise. We had a beautiful view of the Bay of Naples and when we steppedonto the deck we had a wonderful view of Sorrento. The room was comfortable, large by European standards and very clean, although sparse in furniture it made up in having a comfortable bed. The washroom was large with a shower only, and like the room was spotless.
reviews.title: Great Views, Lousy Service

reviews.text: The front desk staff was good - not fantastic - but good. I would say that they will not pamper you, but they will not ignore you. The reasturant we found to be a wonderful place. We had a great meal and the staff were very attentive, and the thing that you can not top is the fantastic view from the reasturant windows and terrace.
reviews.title: Be cautious

reviews.text: We would recommend this hotel, based on our stay.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at La Tonnarella (which,by the way, means small tuna) at the end of September. We booked a standard double room with sea view terrace. The views of the town and the Bay of Naples were spectacular. The service, however was not. Our room had a leaking toilet for the entire 4 days we were there. We reported it to the desk the 1st morning since my husband's sleep was disturbed by the noise. They had their parking valet/handyman take a look, but he said a plumber would be needed to fix it. The hotel never took care of the problem. We kept the bathroom door shut each night, but could still hear the noise. The staff are definitely "uninterested" as stated in the Rick Steeves guidebook. When I asked for information about the ferry service to Capri one morning, I was told the boats were not running that day. I found out later that I was mislead and the ferries ran all day.
reviews.title: Amazing Views

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel in mid March 2005. The weather was great and the views over Sorrento & the sea from our balcony every morning were worth every penny we paid.
reviews.title: Great hotel ... but watch early season
FANTABULOUS Hotel! Amazing, sweeping Views!
reviews.text: The room was well decorated. The bathroom was clean. The only issue could be that both were on the small side. The free WiFi network worked fine from our room.
The staff were friendly, professional and efficient. Breakfast was a typical cold buffet with meats, eggs, fruit & various breads available. Plenty of it.
reviews.title: What a view!
Views views views!!!
reviews.text: Our only issue with the hotel was that on booking it wasn't made clear that the restaurant was closed due to it being early season. As far as I could understand, the season is considered to start at Easter. As this is a moving target, I would recommend double checking that full facilities will be available before you book anytime pre-Easter.

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!
reviews.text: As it was reception recommended a Pizzeria 10 mins walk up the road from the hotel. This serves basic, good value food, and was perfectly adequate for a last minute stand-in. However, not the fine meal we had been expecting after a long journey. Also, the road here has no pavement, so you took your life in your hands walking up to the place in the dark.

reviews.title: Great hotel with amazing views
reviews.text: Just returned from Italy and I loved this hotel… amazing location and beautiful views… the restaurant is fantastic and gets pretty booked so it is advisable to reverse a table for dinner.

reviews.title: I Loved this Place!
reviews.text: I Loved this Place! The first night we were there we could see the fireworks in Naples Bay, WOW! I the breakfast was fairly good, but not out standing. Their private beach was small but clean, it it was nice to swim in the Ocean. The only drawback for some people is that you must like to walk! We walked down the hill and back every day, if you don't like to walk you must pay for a taxi!The rooms were clean and spacious, no carpet in ours, but tile was pretty........book in advance, it's hard to get into during busy travel times!.........Enjoy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here from November 10-13th, 2006 and we loved it. The rooms are grand and have the most wonderful views of Mt. Vesuvio and Sorrento. The bed was very comfortable and the terrace in our room (#24) alone was huge with 180-degree vistas. It was really special just to sit out on the terrace and watch the sights with a glass or two of the local vino rosso. It was a most agreeable stop on our two-week whirlwind Italy tour.
reviews.title: We loved La Tonnarella!!!

reviews.text: Also, the breakfast is quite substantial for Italian standards with a large variety of pastries, meats, cheeses, yogurt, cereals, etc. We will definitely return!
reviews.title: Perfect Wedding Venue

likes.liked: — Fantastic view, fabulous room, delicious food.
likes.disliked: — average breakfast and slow service on front desk.

reviews.text: A note about the staff: some people have indicated that they found the staff to be aloof. We strongly disagree as all of the personnel we encountered were very cordial and attentive. For example, when it was slightly cold in our room one night, we had a portable heater brought immediately, also our car battery died on the morning we left and staff called the owner of the property who came within 10 minutes to personally jump-start it. Now tell me that is inattentive...
reviews.title: Awful. Avoid.

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel on my honeymoon. We had a standard sea view room. The view from the balcony was stunning. The only problems with had was the fact that the beds were the most uncomfortable I had ever slept in and i woke up every morning feeling very bruised. Also the hotel is very noisy first thing in the morning. I am not sure if this was the cleaners or the other guests but we were woken up by about 7am every morning with slamming doors and shouting! It was only about a 15 minute walk to the main town.
reviews.title: Lovely View
Loved the view!
reviews.text: We had our wedding meal at this hotel and they did a brilliant job. The food was delicious and the waiting staff couldn't do enough for us.

reviews.title: Beautiful Sorrento!!
reviews.text: Stayed two nights at LaTonnarella. The view was gorgeous, and the room was very nice, as was the hotel restaurant. We reserved a double room with a view/terrace. Both the terrace and the room were spacious. The staff was professional and helpful. When I emailed the hotel to reconfirm the reservation, I received the friendly reply "we are waiting for you!" and the welcome was warm when we arrived, though it was rather late. I'm hoping to be able to return soon!

reviews.title: Bad attitude
reviews.text: We just returned from a fabulous, relaxing, yet exciting vacation in Sorrento. From the food to the shops to the views...wow!

The Piazza Tasso is where all the 'action' is and we ate 3 times at the Fauno Bar where the food and staff were excellent as well as being extrememly helpful to us with suggestions and directions. We had our daughters with us and they loved it there!
reviews.title: Best for heterosexual couples
